messages.subject: RE: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] DELETE, DELETE, DELETE
messages.msgSnippet: ... Really it s not worth repeating or getting started all over again.  There has been a rather heated debate about Daycare Vs. Stay at home parents, and that
messages.messageBody:
>what have i missed? why are people up in arms? are people being rude or
>just offering opinions... i've been on vacation for almost a week and had to
>delete so much mail... what is the thread that is so objectionable that
>people want to leave the list?


Really it's not worth repeating or getting started all over again. There has been a rather heated debate about Daycare Vs. Stay at home parents, and that was followed by a flaming hot exchange regarding Spanking. Obviously hot topics, as they always are. But not worth repeating. Let's just say that tempers flared, manners were forgotten and it got a little ugly. I hope we can all play nice now.

Nanci K.

------------------------------------------------------------

well, i saw a few of these and even responded to a few... i didn't see anyone
being rude though... just a lot of strong opinions... i think that's a good
thing... still have a lot to read though, so i should reserve opinion...lol



<< Well, let's see -- there was feminism, day care, nursing home care, wahm
and
sahm,
spanking, and probably something I've left out.

But I think the list is back to "normal" now -- whatever that was. :)

Nance (hoping nobody leaves over this)
>>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] DELETE, DELETE, DELETE
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 06/30/2000 12:31:57 PM !!!First Boot!!!, Whyner@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 06/30/2000 12:31:57 PM !!!First Boot!!!, Whyner@...
writes:

<< what is the thread that is so objectionable that
people want to leave the list?
>>

Well, let's see -- there was feminism, day care, nursing home care, wahm and
sahm,
spanking, and probably something I've left out.

But I think the list is back to "normal" now -- whatever that was. :)

Nance (hoping nobody leaves over this)

messages.msgSnippet: hehe ... ok, Dawn, sit down and put your feet up, here z your first lesson in PUTER LINGO ... dd is can be dear daughter, also I use it for dear dog ... ds is
messages.messageBody:
hehe ...

ok, Dawn, sit down and put your feet up, here'z your first lesson in PUTER
LINGO ...

dd is can be dear daughter, also I use it for dear dog ...
ds is dear sister or dear son
dh is dear hubby
dbil dear brother in law
dsil dear sis in law
dmil dear mother in law

OR *D* can be the oppisite w/ *D@*$&$*@* but I don't use that one ... haha
...

ROFLOLWSDDPOMM ... figure that one out!!! haha ...
Pris ~> who'z messin w/ your head!!!

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] DELETE, DELETE, DELETE
messages.msgSnippet: Hi All: I know this is technical and has nothing to do with unschooling, but I need help... I m not familiar with some of the terms used... Could someone tell
messages.messageBody:
Hi All:

I know this is technical and has nothing to do with unschooling, but I need
help... I'm not familiar with some of the terms used... Could someone tell me
what the following mean:

ds, dd, dh, bil, sil, mil. and other abbreviations that are used like this.

I'm sure they are probably quite simple but I'm a bit of an idiot when it
comes to figuring this stuff out (LOL) I do know what that one means...

Dawn F
